newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan cotton rates unchanged in dull trading.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan cotton rates unchanged in dull trading.

text.p: Pakistan's cotton rates ended unchanged on Tuesday in dull trading before the Moslem religious festival of Eid al-Adha and are likely to remain steady in the near term, dealers said.

"Little trading was seen ahead of Eid holidays starting from Thursday," dealer Adil Usman said. "There is little demand from mill owners at present and the prices are likely to remain at these levels after the holidays also."
The Pakistani markets will re-open on Monday.
In the kerb market, the NIAB-78 variety was quoted around 1,900 rupees ($47.24) per maund (37.32 kg), dealers said.
